text:
substance: Copper | type_of_trv: Oral TDI | trv_value: 4.26E-01
mg/kg -day
BW | study_details: Study Type: epidemiological
(prospective)
Species: humans
Mode of Exposure: oral (drinking water)
Exposure Concentrations: healthy
infants 3 to 12 months of age
(n = 128) were given drinking water
with < 0.1 mg copper/L (n = 48) or
2 mg copper/L (n = 80) (added to
drinking water as copper sulfate)
Duration: nine months
Uncertainty Factors: none (attributed
to the homeostatic regulation of copper
absorption and excretion) | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: NOAEL = 2 mg/L
(corresponding to a
mean daily intake of
0.318 mg/kg -day)
BW | trv_derivation_method: TDI = upper bound of
the 95% confidence
interval of the NOAEL | critical_effect_s: Gastrointestinal
toxicity
and
Hepatotoxicity
(liver function) | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA: see 2019
(draft) CMP
assessment
(ECCC and HC,
2019b)
IARC:
not classified
US EPA IRIS:
Group D
not classifiable
as to human
carcinogenicity
(US EPA, 1988a) | source: HC, 2019a
(based on
Olivares et al.,
1998)

substance: Dichlorobenzene,
1,2- | type_of_trv: Oral TDI | trv_value: 4.3E-01
mg/kg -day
BW | study_details: Study Type: chronic
Species: rats and mice
Mode of Administration: gavage,
corn oil
Exposure Regime: 0, 60, or
120 mg/kg -day (male and female rats,
BW
female mice), 30 and 60 mg/kg -day
BW
(male mice), 5 days per week
Duration: 103 weeks
Uncertainty Factors: 100 (10 for
intraspecies variability and 10 for
interspecies variability) | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: NOAEL =
60 mg/kg -day
BW | trv_derivation_method: NOAEL adjusted for
continuous exposure
NOAEL =
adj
43 mg/kg -day
BW
TDI = NOAEL /UF
adj | critical_effect_s: Nephrotoxicity
(increase
in tubular
regeneration
in the kidney) | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA: Group V
probably not
carcinogenic
to humans
(EC and HC, 1993c)
IARC: Group 3
not classifiable as to
its carcinogenicity
to humans
(IARC, 1999b)
US EPA IRIS:
Group D
not classifiable
as to human
carcinogenicity
(US EPA, 1990b) | source: HC, 1996
(based on
NTP, 1985b)
